comments:
I'm constantly getting these errors logged to the .log file -- don't know how I 
got into this state.

java.fullversion=J2RE 1.3.1 IBM Windows 32 build cn131-20020403 (JIT enabled: 
jitc)
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_GB
Command-line arguments: -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -debug -data 
C:\Eclipse\workspace -install file:C:/Eclipse/20020624/eclipse/
!ENTRY org.eclipse.team.core 2 0 Jun 26, 2002 13:00:18.292
!MESSAGE setting global ignore
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.team.core.TeamException: renaming
	at org.eclipse.team.core.Team.saveIgnoreState(Team.java:447)
	at org.eclipse.team.core.Team.shutdown(Team.java:530)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.TeamPlugin.shutdown
(TeamPlugin.java:77)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginRegistry$2.run
(PluginRegistry.java:279)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run
(InternalPlatform.java:831)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginRegistry$1.visit
(PluginRegistry.java:292)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginRegistry.accept
(PluginRegistry.java:51)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginRegistry.shutdownPlugins
(PluginRegistry.java:295)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginRegistry.shutdown
(PluginRegistry.java:261)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.loaderShutdown
(InternalPlatform.java:510)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.shutdown
(InternalBootLoader.java:878)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:780)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:462)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:248)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:698)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:534)

From looking at the code, the most likely scenario is that the old file could 
not be deleted so the new one could't be renamed. You may want to check if the 
file .metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.team.core/.globalIgnores is read-only.

The code in Team.saveIgnoreState() is 

   if (stateFile.exists())
      stateFile.delete();
   boolean renamed = tempFile.renameTo(stateFile);

The delete() returns a boolean indicating whether the operation succeeded or 
not. We should check that boolean as well. We should also print the file path 
that caused the problem as part of the exception istead of just providing the 
simple text "renaming".

Nope the file is not read-only.

I have since moved onto GM4, and the problem has just as mysteriously 
disappeared ;-)
*** Bug 16903 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The problem has been identified as improper stream closure under certain 
circumstances. 

Fix released to HEAD
